website_summaries.verdict: Smaller, lighter pack that is designed for day hikes or daily use.
pros: Even though this pack is smaller than some others on our list, it can be attached to larger Osprey packs as an optional pod pack
cons: Doesn't attach easily to all Osprey packs, so make sure to try it first

customer_reviews.title: Great for day hikes and as an under seat carry ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for day hikes and as an under seat carry on. Did the southern Utah national parks and the it performed as advertised. Carried two water bottles in the mesh pockets, a larger bottle in the interior compartment along with a second pair of lighter shoes and plenty of snacks. The straps distribute the load quite comfortably. As a carry on, I was able to carry my iPad, Kindle, snacks for the 4 hour plane ride, plus everything that has to come out of your pockets to pass through security. A small lap top would also fit in the storage compartment for the electronics.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase
customer_reviews.text: I could not be happier with this backpack. As a train commuter I have been using a bulky Swiss Gear backpack for the past 5 years. It has held up really well but I wanted something more streamlined. I was SHOCKED that all of my gear, laptop included, fits into this smaller pack with room to spare. On top of that, the weight distributes across my shoulders and chest in such a way that I can barely tell I am carrying anything. All the same gear, but it feels 15 pounds lighter than my old backpack. Kudos to Osprey! I will be a customer for life. Super impressed
customer_reviews.author: Eric H.

customer_reviews.title: Not great for petite people
customer_reviews.text: Bag is way too big for a petite female to wear. When I put it on, for the bottom of the bag to rest on my lower back and the chest and waist strap to hit where they should, the top part of my bag has to ride up so that it is about 3 inches taller than my shoulders. Therefore, the extra bag was digging into my neck. Bag is also pretty stiff and the laptop pocket area felt very cheap. Material overall also feels cheaper than most Osprey bags do. Only thing I liked about it was the color.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Useless water bottle pockets.
customer_reviews.text: I tried the Daylite, Daylite Plus, and Daylite Travel and they all have useless water bottle pockets. My water bottle fell out every time I set the packs down or bent over. I read about this in other people's reviews but thought, "This is Osprey, they can't really have made a pack (or 3) with useless water bottle pockets!" But they did. Even if I could have gotten over the useless water bottle pockets, I wouldn't have kept them. I wore them around town for a weekend, but they never felt comfortable because of the the way the straps connect at the top of the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Wrld Trvlr

customer_reviews.title: Great travel bag. Color online is different in-person. (Stone Grey/Sage and Petrol Blue)
customer_reviews.text: I got both the Stone Grey/Sage and Petrol Blue versions. They do look a bit different in-person compared to online pictures. The fitting for the side pockets is also different depending on the color. The Petrol Blue has deeper pockets which allow for a better hold of longer water bottles. If you use wider ones, like the Nalgene wide-mouth, this is not a problem. All-in-all a great travel bag. Very lightweight and really holds a lot of stuff. I use it as my daily work bag and as a travel/hike bag.
customer_reviews.author: Fox2_Eagle1

customer_reviews.title: The center "stuff pack" is a perfect fit for a 32oz Nalgene bottle
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the most versatile day pack around. It's durable, compact and gets it done. The center "stuff pack" is a perfect fit for a 32oz Nalgene bottle. I've found the side pockets are best for drying socks or something similar; those pockets wont hold a bottle. It has a waste strap that is thankfully removable, but it is a nice touch for some people is assume. The pack is pretty water resistant as well. I took it on a float trip recently and it repelled the water that landed on it. All in all, it's a well built pack backed by the best warranty in the industry.
customer_reviews.author: Jarod

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but some design problems
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these packs for a 3 week trip to Scandinavia. They are lightweight and the mesh back is great. My wife really hated that the pack could not be stood up on its bottom, even when leaning against a chair. The bottom contour does not allow it to sit flat. The water holder nets were poorly shaped to hold a water bottle--it constantly fell out. The two compartment zipper were on top very close to one another so we were always opening the small compartment when we wanted the big one. The small upper compartment needs to be deeper. We will not be using these packs again.
customer_reviews.author: Boat owner

customer_reviews.title: Good backpack, a bit small
customer_reviews.text: What was I shopping for: - A backpack for 2-3 days on the road that could fit 2 changes of clothing, laptop, toiletries and other tech accessories. Positives: - Good overall design - While small, still supports a laptop - Great water bottle storage options Negatives: - Too small for my needs - Even though it supports a laptop, there isn't a lot of padding for it - The outside open air pocket feels awkward (what do I use it for??) Overall: Backpack seems better suited for a day hike or for a cyclist. I ultimately decided to return it because of its size.
customer_reviews.author: bijan711

customer_reviews.title: Osprey Purple Day Pack!
customer_reviews.text: New favorite day bag for adventures! I use this when I go on vacation, it was the perfect size for taking snacks, cameras, binoculars and extra clothing when whale watching. it is the perfect size for water and other items needed when going on day long hikes. It's also perfect for when in the city! Small enough to stay out of the way and not bump into everyone. Big enough to fit everything we needed for the day. It is also very light weight, but the same great quality as all the Osprey items I love!
customer_reviews.author: Buffapup

customer_reviews.title: Great with a couple of complaints.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a small, lightweight pack for a hike lasting a couple of hours. It's comfortable, lightweight, and seems to be very durable. Another reviewer complained about the side pockets not being tight enough to hold a water bottle and they were exactly right. Lean just slightly too far forward and you'll be picking your bottle off the ground. Not a big deal for most people but I enjoy geocaching and that involves looking around on the ground quite a bit. It's very frustrating to have stuff falling out constantly. That's just nitpicking, to be honest, and this is a solid backpack. Don't overfill it. It quickly gets uncomfortable with too much in the main compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Not for short torso and strap connector digs into neck!
customer_reviews.text: I so wanted to love this pack, but the mesh connect that connects the shoulder straps digs into my upper back/lower neck area. The pack itself is long and the bottom rides on the top of my butt. I think this would be a great backpack for someone taller. Indeed it fits my husband, 6'2", just fine. I'm 5'5" with a slightly shorter torso for my height, so keep that in mind if you're built like me! I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Sookiebird

customer_reviews.title: Eh at best
customer_reviews.text: First off, the black is not black at all. It is definitely navy blue with a lighter blue front. The picture is way mis-leading. Second, the quality is meh at best. Definitely does not feel as nice as my other Osprey. The fabric is thin, the zippers feel cheap, the chest/waist straps and tiny and feel cheap. Third, it is really small. Looks awkwardly small on me. Would probably fit a petite adult well, but looks tiny on me. Plus I the way the back support is integrated, it doesn't seem like it would hold much at all. Overall not impressed at all, especially compared to other Osprey bags I've had. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: DJM

customer_reviews.title: Great light, smaller backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Osprey makes some pretty nice backpacks. I have at least 3 of them and the quality and features are quite impressive. I will say that one of them was a life saver when I was traveling in Japan. It's versatility and ability to hold a lot of things was great. This one is just a much smaller version of that other backpack. I think this one does not have enough pockets. And this one also has a strange opening in the center which does not have a zipper so things might fall out. But it is super light, I do hope it will stand up to my papers and files back and forth to work.
customer_reviews.author: JVSGUSCASD

customer_reviews.title: Major drawback for cycling
customer_reviews.text: The pack holds a ton and it’s compartments are actually useful. The laptop sleeves holds my 15 inch MacBook Pro and there is a separate sleeve for a water bladder. My issue is I use it for bike commuting, and with my laptop in the padding on the back of the pack isn’t sufficient. I don’t have particularly prominent vertebrae and have average body fat/composition. But in a cycling position it seems the weight of the pack balances on my mid spine - with painful results. If you’re carrying a light load or using this for travel I would say go for it. But beware the thin padding.
customer_reviews.author: Kimpaleo

customer_reviews.title: Osprey Makes Nice Daypack's but...
customer_reviews.text: They need to size the straps and belts with more length, so that plus size users can enjoy them too. I can barely buckle the belt around my waist, and the straps seemed way too close to the neck, so it pulled awkwardly at the armpit area. Not comfortable at all, so disappointed especially with how much I paid. Hey everyone - fat girls hike too!
customer_reviews.author: Seeking Sense

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good bag, great price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag to use on day hikes or other various ways. It’s been a great bag for hiking and stores just enough without being too big and bulky. I wish the straps had a little more padding, if you’re carrying heavy items it may not distribute the weight the way you’d like compared to sturdier bags. Also, in order to use the water bottle pockets on the side you will need to attach your bottles with carabiners or else they will fall out. I don’t know what their thoughts on the pocket engineering is, but they are neither deep enough or wide enough to support regular bottles. Other than that I am really happy with the bag!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: UNCOMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: The second I tried this bag on my first impression was this bag is very uncomfortable. It feels like a piece of cardboard pressed against your back and the straps are not comfortable. It is also wayyyy to small for the frame of my body and I would consider my size average. I do not recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Llocsird'o Ttam

customer_reviews.title: Good one
customer_reviews.text: i use it for day hikes. It has enough space and compartments. UPDATE: I have used this backpack for long/ high altitude hikes and found out it lacks support for the lower back. It’s great for short day hikes Carrying not much of a weight.
customer_reviews.author: AkiraDay

customer_reviews.title: Great Pack!
customer_reviews.text: Not too big, not too small - perfect size for a day hike. I live in AZ and swear by the ventilated straps. For me it helps. My husband and I both have the same pack and it fits us both well. It just looks a bit smaller on him, but appropriate in size not too small or feminine. This does not come with a bladder, but it is compatible and a 3L bladder will fit. Like everything we own made by Osprey, we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Herdie

customer_reviews.title: Everything and more!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a 'REAL' backback for hiking in Europe and this was recommended by several people. I checked it out at retail stores for much more $$ and the fit looked good but not the color I wanted. This is PERFECT!! The color is amazing! Has every thing I need. Now I am ready!
customer_reviews.author: Ldygeek

customer_reviews.title: Super pack
customer_reviews.text: This is a super, light weight and comfortable pack. Lots of pockets. Very functional. I have usually purchased larger packs, thinking I needed the extra space. Not so. With imaginative thinking and flexibility, I have found that this bag fits all the things I need to carry, including a rain jacket, toilet kit, t shirt, 1 pr socks, 1 pr shorts, and a tablet. I am not at all concerned about the side pockets. They are great for storing other things. One of the best aspects of this bag is its light weight. Buy one soonest.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: A MUST FOR OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES
customer_reviews.text: I have this bag for a couple of weeks and I think if you are a intermediate hiker you definitely need this. I didn’t know that the H2O compartment was separates but when I discover it, it totally blow my mind. The only thing I have against this bag is there’s no iPhone pocket on the strap but all the compartments hold all my first aid kit and extra clothes, ropes and carabiners. The chest and hip strap is awesome for when you want to runs and it prevent the bag from moving too much. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR THE HIKERS in YOU.
customer_reviews.author: K. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Very good product, minus waterbottle holder
customer_reviews.text: This product is great, amazing zippers, great laptop storage and very comfortable. Highly compatible with the osprey hydration pack (duh) and great overall. Single complaint being that if your bag is rather full the angle of the water bottle holders can be too small for medium to big waterbottles without additionally clipping in with the adjustable side strap. This is my daily ski carry.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great size, great fit!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip where I knew I’d need a backpack for my carry on and for day trips. I now take it to work everyday. It’s a great pack! Small enough that it’s not bulky, but roomy enough for a laptop, iPad, and other items. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is great and exactly what we wanted for our upcoming Disney World trip! It's lightweight but also holds a lot. There are enough small pockets for easy access to little things. There is a space for a water pouch if we wanted to use one. We are very happy with this purchase. I may come back and update my review after our trip.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: My favorite pack! Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this pack for about 7 months and use it at least 5 times a week... for travel, hiking, diaper bag, and long distance cycling. It’s comfortable to wear. The durability and built in organization system is perfectly designed. But, what motivated me to come back and write a review is how easy this bag cleaned up in the washer, even though the website says to only spot treat. Spot treating anything is a joke, in my opinion. Especially with two toddlers and traveling through airports, the woods etc. After a long debate with myself, I removed the spine and washed/dried on delicate by itself with dreft detergent. And what do you know - looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for day hikes/plane rides
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this pack and used it for traveling throughout Europe. Fits nicely under the seat on the plane and on my back. Very stylish and LOVED the color (yellow and blue). I could fit my kindle in it as well as groceries or items I bought. My water bottle was secure in the side pockets. I plan on using it for mountain biking and day hikes.
customer_reviews.author: mtnmarie

customer_reviews.title: I love this size backpack
customer_reviews.text: I love this size backpack. Just right for walking around town or throwing your school books into to carry to class. My daughter actually re-appropriated this to her collection of things before I had a chance to use it myself. She can fit all her books, pens, cords, etc. into it and tells me it's very comfortable to wear. She is quite a bit smaller than I am, but we both were able to get the straps adjusted to fit ourselves comfortably. I like the Osprey brand and think their construction is very solid. I expect this pack to last quite a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Virbage

customer_reviews.title: Perfect just perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Recently did a 20 mile hike over the continental divide in Colorado with this new bag and it was great. I was able to pack three 500ml water bottles, my main 1L hydro flask in the front, a small jacket inside the main pocket along with my DSLR with a decent sized lens along with food and other things packed it was closed to 13lbs. I did felt like it was a bit over packed and I did have my doubts at first however I had no issues whatsoever. It was super comfortable, everything felt right and all the compartments worked as designed. 5 stars from me!
customer_reviews.author: AlexTakesPhotos

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Day Pack
customer_reviews.text: This pack is a perfect day pack. I love the size of the bag. I have been surprised how much I can fit in there every time I pack it. Example: 2L water bladder on outside pocket, raincoat, first aid, hat, gloves, fleece jacket, socks, food, headlamp, all with room to spare. It sits nicely on my back. I worried about the narrow waist strap, but I haven't had any problems with a sore back due to uneven weight distribution. My friend borrowed this pack on a hike and loved it so much she bought her own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Osprey
customer_reviews.text: My family and I love to be outdoors and go hiking. I have a hard time carrying packs on my shoulders. This daypack is made with comfort in mind. I can carry all of my supplies with easy. I love that the side storage is tilted backwards so that I can retrieve my water bottle without having to take off the pack - a big plus. The best part of Osprey is that they guarantee their products for life. So if something goes wrong, you can send it in and they will fix it or replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to combine with the Osprey Porter travel ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to combine with the Osprey Porter travel backpack and I have to say this thing is incredible. This system has been all over the world with me and allowed me to carry much more than I could with a regular suitcase. Also it fits on my back and allows me to get through all of the trains and public transportation offered in other parts of the country without having to drag a suitcase around cobble streets. I can move quickly and efficiently through the cities and get to my destination with all my belongings attached to me.
customer_reviews.author: Felice Navidad

customer_reviews.title: Almost the perfect back pack
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is so close to being perfect. I use it as my daily pack for back and forth to work as a high school teacher and its really good and super durable. The only problem it has is that my water bottles constantly fall out of the side pouches. I wish I had listened to the other reviewers and maybe made a different purchase. this is a major drawback for me and is a constant annoyance. Other than that it is literally the perfect back pack.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome travel pack! Better for those taller
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our trip overseas as a day pack when we were out and about. Comfortable and easy to hold all the stuff we needed for our 1 yr old for the day. I’m a taller guy (6’1”) and it fit great. My wife (5’4”) could wear it but not as comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Architect

customer_reviews.title: Buyer BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: Dont see what all the fuss is about, its a cheap small plastic backpack. A very poor quality backpack at that. Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Patricia H.

customer_reviews.title: not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is what i would expect from Walmart at the back to school section. This pack reeks of cheapness with very thin straps and small size. At least i got this cheapo garbage on sale. Back to North Face where i know i will get a REAL pack. My dog would be ashamed to wear this.
customer_reviews.author: Pooch

customer_reviews.title: great backpack for daily stuff
customer_reviews.text: I bought this great little backpack for a recent trip I took to Alaska and I was very impressed by it. Could easily hold all the gear(rain jacket, cameras, binoculars, guide books, snacks, water etc.) I needed for any day trip/tour I went on. Numerous pockets to keep everything organized, comfortable to wear/carry. Highly recommend it !!
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Dresser

customer_reviews.title: Very small pack, very very small straps
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a man's day pack. This pack might fit a slim young high school boy or girl with a jacket on but it certainly would not have fit my 230lbs, 6' 2" frame for anything. Why don't product descriptions say who something like this might be best suited for? My wife weighs 107lbs, is 5' 4" and this pack barely fit her without a jacket on? I hate returning stuff but had no choice! Otherwise it seemed like a nice "little" pack???
customer_reviews.author: DAMorrow

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect hiking/weekend backpack
customer_reviews.text: This bag is exactly what I had been looking for. The size is perfect for me, it is not too small but it’s also not too big and omg the color, love it, its called real red. The bag has a bladder, a main and a small compartment... a small pocket with zipper in the front, another small storage space right behind that and two mesh pockets on each side. For references I am 5’7”. I will update my review at a later time.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: So this is strange, but this bag came delivered smelling strongly of graham crackers. Anyways, it seems to be great for a little every-day carry kind of bag. Large internals that have enough padding for a 15" laptop, but also all your gear, some clothes, etc. Would make a good hiking bag but since I have so many of those already, I wanted this one to be used more around the city and on commutes.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Fits everything a mom needs for three small kiddos (not hiking)
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this as a mom bag most of the time. It fits everything I and the kids need and one day when I go hiking I’ll use it for that too. My 40oz hydro flask fits inside just fine and the straps are very comfy. I does flip over when I set it down (not my fav thing) so I have to be careful that kids are on tight. I love that’s it’s comfy which I need when I’m chasing kids through the zoo, museum, store, park.
customer_reviews.author: DAD^3

customer_reviews.title: My favorite simple pack for hiking, travel, and day-to-day activities.
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is quickly becoming my favorite pack for short hiking trips, an extra bag for travel, and general day-to-day activities. It's comfortable, light, and has ample room for the basics. The inside comfortably fits a small laptop with room for basic accessories, a jacket, snacks, etc. I often use it to carry around my DSLR camera even though it's not specifically designed for it (I added some foam liners that i can slip in for added padding). Bottom line, this is a great pack with a lot of options for it's weight and size. I'd buy another one without thinking about it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent weekend pack
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tough little bag for weekend trips on the ala carte airlines like Spirit and Frontier who would charge more for carry-ons. They don't charge me for this bag. I fold 2 days worth of clothes and put them in a kitchen trash bag, then sit on it to get the air out, tie it off, then the clothes slide nicely into this backpack with room to spare. I've also used it for stashing things away from the reach of pickpockets while walking around in Europe. It's light enough to carry all day.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for day hikes
customer_reviews.text: I am writing an update since we used the back pack on a hiking vacation. The back back is a perfect size and weight. It seemed to be balanced. With lots of sections/pockets it is extremely handy for packing everything we needed for day hikes. I highly recommend it! I bought this for a vacation we have planned with several day hikes. I haven't used it yet, but I can say it holds way more than I thought it would. Blue color is really bright and will hide dirt the lighter colors wouldnt. I will post an updated review once we use it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill H

customer_reviews.title: Light weight - well constructed.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older a slightly larger day pack. The storage compartments are well laid out. The zippers seem to be of high quality (pending what I hope to be several years of use). Noticeable weight reduction. My main use is carry some small items for long (5-8 mile) day hike / dog walks. It has a large area for a water bladder that I have not used, but may. Currently just carry a water bottle in the side pocket. Overall very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Love it for travel, but not hiking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a hiking pack, but it's too long. I'm 5'6 and even with the shoulders adjusted it hits me below my hips - almost mid-butt. The think top handle is also pretty stiff and rubs against my neck. That said, I'm keeping it as a purse / computer bag. Great compartments, holds a water bottle and my 13' Airbook fits perfectly! Slung over one shoulder, it's perfect. Strapped on like a backpack - not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for lightness daypack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack to go in my travel backpack to use as day pack at destination. In international flight they are picky about bag weight. I believe this pack weights less than a pound. In-country a 20L allows me to carry my travel umbrella, gloves, shell jacket and base layers, snacks, water bottle, map and binos. In warm weather I can shed much making it really light and comfortable pack to carry..
customer_reviews.author: King_Cobra

customer_reviews.title: Perfect day pack!
customer_reviews.text: I was using a Camelbak Mule for my day hikes, but it just didn't have enough space, especially for all the gear I needed to bring for winter hiking. I am really loving this pack so far. Plenty of space to clip things on the outside for easy access & lots of space inside. It has a hydration sleeve as well as an additional sleeve inside for anything you might need. I personally use the water bottle holders on the side for my poles and it has worked great so far. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Allyson

customer_reviews.title: Four months in and I'm still loving it!
customer_reviews.text: Two years ago I bought an Osprey Atmos pack (that I really like) and when it came time to find a new everyday pack, Osprey immediately came to mind. It really is amazing the amount of gear that you can pack into this (relatively) small day pack. It's comfortable enough for an extended day hike, and sturdy enough to fill with the stuff you need using it as a commuter pack, day after day.
customer_reviews.author: Weezill

customer_reviews.title: Different color stitching?
customer_reviews.text: You can see in the photo Osprey made a little stitching that doesn't belong there almost looks like from the factory they had to fix a little tear this was a brand new out-of-the-box. So I am return hopefully next one won't have The same defect. I have a backpacking pack from osprey that I love so I'm still giving them three stars
customer_reviews.author: jeff Stocker

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and practical
customer_reviews.text: Er do a lot of hiking in New Mexico. This pack is just right for day trips. It holds a water bladder etc. I like that I can attach poles and pads using the side mesh pockets and have the flap pocket to hold extra clothing. I have another bigger Osprey pack, but I like this one better because it is lightweight. Bought one for my husband too, who is very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mecki

customer_reviews.title: My New Go-To Pack for Day Hiking and Travel
customer_reviews.text: After 5 months of use, this pack has become my go-to bag for day hikes and as a small carry-on when traveling. The webbed side pouches are great for carrying my Stanley vacuum water bottles (I use the 24 oz and the 36 oz, depending on the hike), as the side strap can be passed through the loop in the spout lid, thus securing the bottle. I have found Osprey products to be of the highest quality, with thoughtful designs that offer more storage options than expected. I expect to get many years of use from this bag -- a surprise as I was reluctant to downsize from my older, larger, pack (also from Osprey).
customer_reviews.author: M Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, useful backpack
customer_reviews.text: I bought the red one to go with my luggage and to get away from black, which I usually get. Took it on a cruise and worked good as my carry-on bag. I'm disabled, so don't want to overfill a big one; found it held all I needed easily. Water holders on both sides could be deeper, my bottle fell out, but other then that it's a beautiful and tough backpack. I really like the red color!
customer_reviews.author: Sweetpea

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack!
customer_reviews.text: This far exceeded my expectations. It made it a full week going through airports with my laptop, several days at Disney World as a day pack, and has so many great features. I can't wait to take it camping and hiking this summer! Great value for the price. My 15" laptop fit nice and snug and the mesh backing helped me avoid major sweating in the Orlando heat. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Magnificent7

customer_reviews.title: Neck is very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Osprey makes a great product. I bought the Farview 40L as my carry-on and bought this to accompany it as my daypack for when I go to Japan next month. Both are great quality. The Farview is extremely comfortable even when loaded, but this one's got a weird design where the handle is connected to the shoulder straps. The handle ends up putting pressure on my neck constantly, unless I loosen the straps to be uncomfortably low on my back. Ended up returning it, and now waiting for delivery of the Momentum 26, in hopes that it'll be more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: The best daypack for hikes
customer_reviews.text: VERY comfortable backpack. I used this as a daypack while traveling in Iceland and it was just what I needed. I'm a small person (5'4" and 125lbs), so anything larger than this just looks ridiculous on me. It even had space on the back for a hydration bladder--huge plus! I did quite a bit of research on backpacks. I bought and returned another, cheaper brand, that just did not sit well on my back and the straps scratched my neck. But this bag did not do that at all. Osprey knows how to make fantastic outdoor gear. If I ever need to buy another backpack, I know where to go :)
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for daytrippers!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect backpack for our trips to Disneyworld. It is lightweight and compact, but still has plenty of room for 2 tablets, battery recharges, water bottles, sunscreen, wallets, keys, and everything we need on a day trip for a family of four. The material is water resistant (definitely not waterproof), as we got caught in a downpour and everything inside stayed reasonably dry. Overall, excellent workmanship and quality. I expect it to last a good, long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S.

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality/quality! Small straps
customer_reviews.text: Great light little bag! The width of the straps are a bit narrow with not much padding, so I imagine long hikes would dig into your shoulders. But over all love the look and quality. I biked thru the rain today and it held up well. Even the mud beaded off with the water. Not a fan of the black and the blue w/yellow colors. I traded in for the red 👌🏻
customer_reviews.author: Rob Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, durable.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for run commuting. I have used it daily for the last month running between 3 and 8 miles packed with clothes and lunch. It is comfortable and roomy enough for the essentials. I removed the belly strap right out of the box. Not water proof. I wash it weekly using in a mesh laundry bag to keep the straps from tangling. It is not showing any signs of wear. Pockets are thoughtfully placed.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & compact
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a backpack that I could take on day hikes with the kids, and this one has met my expectations. It's very lightweight, I was able to easily fit a raincoat, snacks, kids' nature journals, large camera, etc without making the pack feel too bulky or awkward. I was concerned about the neck crosspiece, after reading some negative reviews about it, but it doesn't bother me at all. Overall, the backpack is very comfortable for my body type. I ended up just using it as a purse my last couple of northern Michigan trips. It was my first time buying this brand, will definitely look at Osprey products for future needs.
customer_reviews.author: Ahimsa

customer_reviews.title: Good pack, not as an addition to another larger pack
customer_reviews.text: I like this day pack, I got it because I wanted to attach it to my Osprey Porter 46L which totally does not work never try it. I love the purple color, it suits me. It’s a great pack for taking it to the beach or day hikes, it fits a LOT of stuff that I don’t need, I probably could have gone smaller because it’s pretty big for my frame, it hits my butt while I’m walking if the straps aren’t tight enough. I would recommend this pack for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and would buy again ONLY if it’s cheaper!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for festival or camping or hiking or road trip or anything light day trip! It has plenty of bags to have your things cleanly separated :) the ONLY downside is there’s no mini waist zip... the daypack that I have before isn’t as good as this one but my favorite thing about my previous bag before was at the bottom of the shoulder carrier thingy, there was two small bags for conveniently put your phone, wallet, tickets, anything small! This is also really pricy.... I guessed it’s brand and all so I’m hoping this will last me for a really long time!
customer_reviews.author: Dao Phong

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I didn't believe all the good reviews this thing got. But now that I have one, it's amazing. It holds more stuff than my last one, but is smaller,lighter, and organizes better. It only got docked on water resistance because of the open pouch on the front. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: This pack is just AMAZING! Osprey knows how to engineer a good pack
customer_reviews.text: This pack is just AMAZING! Osprey knows how to engineer a good pack. It has all kinds of pockets and I love the buckle in the front and it's great for hanging a swimsuit on when you're hiking back from the lake. I'm not a pink person but this color is beautiful and looks good even at it's dirtiest. The frame on the back and the waist and chest straps make it feel weightless even at it's heaviest. It's a slim pack that makes a perfect hiker, carry on or travel bag.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: The perfect post-knee surgery on-crutches backpack for work and PT!
customer_reviews.text: Small but mighty, this is so adjustable, it worked amazing for papers to the copy machine, notebooks to meetings, PT clothing with shoes, you name it... all the while on crutches!! Not to wide and secure with he waist strap, this little bugger saved my life for six months!! It cinches down small when you need it to and expands out for bulkier items easily, without getting to wide for arms moving on crutches back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Great well make backpack
customer_reviews.text: Great well make backpack. I will get a lot of use out of this. I recently took it on a trip to Cuba and it worked out perfectly. It made a great carry on bag and well as an everyday sightseeing bag. Held a lot of stuff and had a lot of compartments and pockets yet not that big to be bulky and in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Famila klier

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and well-made
customer_reviews.text: Really nice lightweight daypack. It’s small though, with no real suspension. Don’t expect to be able to carry more than 15 lbs comfortably. Also, the mesh pockets are shallow and loosely fitted - they don’t hold on to mny different water bottles very well. All that said, the back frame and strap construction are very comfortable and effective. The compression straps work well, and the pack works really well for it’s size, without being bulky. I’ve taken it on planes, hiking, swimming, skiing, to the park, to work, grocery shopping, and more. It’s just a great size.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Nice all purpose small backpack
customer_reviews.text: This is has been a great backpack. I use it for hiking and traveling. It is not terribly big but enough to fit a days worth of clothes, water, snacks and with room for extra. I have not taken out on any overnight trips so I cannot speak to that. It has held up very well over the past year. It is nice that it has a sleeve for a laptop or tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Black Color Option Deceiving
customer_reviews.text: Blue is the new Black? I ordered the Osprey Daylite Plus Daypack in Black but this is an overall Blue with Grey and some Black. I’m disappointed the image does not match the product I received so I will be returning. The size is great and I like that it has a lot of pockets but if I would have seen the actual image or one close to it, I would not have selected this color combination. Black or Pink are my two go to colors. I attached 4 photos (2 with flash & 2 without) to show its true colors.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Too small. One size does not fit all.
customer_reviews.text: The backpack is made out of strong material and great for heavy duty use. I did not like the center zipper pocket and has to dig on both sides for my keys. This backpack is one size but it was too small. The check straps were under my chin and very uncomfortable. Im 5’4” and the pack was too high on my back.
customer_reviews.author: Arbil

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a ONE day, only, pack. It will not stand up on its own. It will, fall over whenever you place it down. Approx 7 months later - BOTH - top zippers stick, horribly. Frustrat'n! I will buy a bigger, cheaper pack at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: MMM

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Daylite Plus, and that probably gives you a sense of my opinion of these packs. They're conveniently sized and fairly comfortable to carry. The configuration of the water bottle pockets isn't ideal, and I do wish there were more attachment points (especially an easy way to connect trekking poles to the pack), but otherwise I'm quite pleased. Perhaps the most important facet: the no-questions-asked Osprey repair/replacement policy. Cooling mesh on the back panel and the hydration sleeve are also big benefits.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Good Day Pack
customer_reviews.text: This is a good pack for day h8k8ng b Its comfortable, and the vented pad in the back helps keep it from being too hot. As other reviewers have mentioned, normal water bottles do not stay in place when stowed in the side pockets. I found 2 16 oz rectangular water bottles that will stay in place, however.
customer_reviews.author: DiggerGirl

customer_reviews.title: High quality but limited space / pockets
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is well made but the layout is not the most ideal. There is very few places to store things the zippered area that has pockets is tiny and other than the main compartment with the laptop goes there's nothing else that's zippered or closes securely. a 15 inch laptop does NOT fit unless it's the bare laptop (bare 15 inch macbook should fit but not with a protective sleeve on it)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Holland

customer_reviews.title: I love this pack!
customer_reviews.text: I got it to replace another backpack for walks around town in the summer. I have dozens of backpacks, but they all seem to keep me a little warm on those 80+ F days. This bag did not disappoint. It fits my water bottle and organizes enough little items to be greatly useful. In a time where I want to carry "just enough" with me, this bag fits the bill! I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Timbrwolf22

customer_reviews.title: Cruise back pack
customer_reviews.text: This is the best backpack for travel. I cruise a lot and I love how comfy it feels on my back, the multiple compartments, and the size. Perfect for cruising and shore excursions! So glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Christinadollface

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Everything as expected and more from Osprey. Love the color, great loading and doesn't fatigue me carry heavy load for extended period. No regrets. Great for hiking and travelling.
customer_reviews.author: SKKS

customer_reviews.title: A perfect backpack!
customer_reviews.text: A very nice backpack. Very light, plenty of room, and I like best that it can connect to larger Osprey backpacks with ease. I would definitely recommend this. It even has a slot for an iPad or a small computer, protected by a spine. I definitely recommend this backpack. It’s perfect for hiking or any outing which you prefer not to carry a purse. The way it is set up, and the straps that go around your body help distribute the weight so it’s comfortable even when on the heavy side.
customer_reviews.author: Trish C

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I just used this touring all around Israel. It’s a day backpack but held so much stuff. I ended up using it as my carryon at the airport too and packed it so heavily, but was so easy to wear and very comfortable. I was super impressed for using a backpack for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great as a day bag
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack. If you’re purchasing for hiking, it would be a great add-on but by itself it can hold enough for a day trip. It has a firm back which I like because you can push it to the limit and it not be painful to carry. I like the brand so will purchase again in a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Marteel

customer_reviews.title: Different pack than the image they use!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Black Osprey Daylite Plus Daypack. The pictures showed a sleek, solid black pack. What I received is black and blue, with mesh panels, and nothing like the slim sleek design in the pictures. And it’s very distinctly blue. Trivial, yes, but I wanted what I ordered, not a blue and black back pack. Still- Osprey has the best packs, I only travel with my 46 porter (it’s heavinly) I wanted a day pack I could attach to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great Day Bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great "personal item" complement to my Porter 46. I've traveled several times now with both. Love the construction and design. Minus one star for the attachment system between the bags - I expect something a little more user friendly and quick - I'd love to see them connect so they could hang front-and-back of the user, like on my Farpoint 55!
customer_reviews.author: Shane Sattler

customer_reviews.title: Pitched Neck
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to this pack. I tried it on and was surprised how much the should straps pitch into my neck. I tried adjusting the straps, but it never improved. It was very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A. Medlock

customer_reviews.title: the top of the shoulder straps were in an awkard place
customer_reviews.text: Reading all the reviews and thought this bag would be great for commuting to work. Without anything in it, the top of the straps were right on the base of my neck. It's summer now where I am. The design would just create irritation to my skin. Returning. :(
customer_reviews.author: bun

customer_reviews.title: The lift you get when you don't feel like you're carrying a backpack is quite the difference
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight. The lift you get when you don't feel like you're carrying a backpack is quite the difference. This is quite durable and well constructed. Color and design looks great. My gf wore it on her trip with me to NYC and was pleasantly surprised. Honestly, I want one as well as soon as I can afford it. Also super breathable so she benefited with a dry back while I sweated in mine.
customer_reviews.author: Soap

customer_reviews.title: Work and Play!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these because I love them so much. One I use for day hiking and the other I use for work. Perfect amount of space, my laptop fits nicely and there are some great pockets. The straps are supportive and the foam/mesh back is great for hot days hiking!
customer_reviews.author: R. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Lots to adjust
customer_reviews.text: It took awhile to get the suggested to my body. It felt like it was up too high and bracing the back of my skull like the back of a life jacket does. I eventually got it and I'm happy with it. It doesn't fall against my back so there is nice room for air to get in between, but I'm not sure how I'll stay out like that when the bag is full and if i was climbing and gravity is shifting it.
customer_reviews.author: L amor

customer_reviews.title: Quality. Comfort. Utility. Is there more?
customer_reviews.text: My wife was seeking a comfortable day pack. Not large. Roomy enough for essentials and emergency situations. We saw a lady wearing one of these on our D.C. trip last fall and she related the quality, comfort and utility of the pack. Sold! And my wife agrees.
customer_reviews.author: L.C.

customer_reviews.title: 2 years and still perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have had this bag for a while now. I used it as my carry-on while flying to Europe. I now use it as my flight bag (flying Cessnas). This bag shows no sign of of stress or damage. This bag has held up fine. The zippers still work like new, the seams are fine. Quality doesn't get any better. I am surprised how well it's doing.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: These Osprey's are great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a new found respect for Osprey after purchasing this bag. Its very light, plenty of pockets and compartments. Dual zippers where you want and need it. Straps are easily adjusted with quick adjusting tabs. My only complaint is I wish there was a grippier material/lining on the straps for those who have problems with backpacks sliding off their shoulder. Still a great lightweight backpack!
customer_reviews.author: Peter C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hiking!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for Hiking. Light weight, plenty of cargo space for everything you need. Fit 2 north face jacks, 2 raincoats, snacks, 2 water bottles, emergency kit, dog bowl and extra gear all in this one back pack. It’s breathable in the back, had straps that clip in The front to prevent from sliding off the shoulder and kept in place. And it has a built in whistle! The quality was outstanding. Overall, a VERY Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Such a great pack. Fits a lot of stuff and has many compartments for anything you might need while hiking. I would highly recommend buying a water bladder to go along with the pack, since the water bottle pouches on the sides are very flimsy and a water bottle would easily fall out. I've taken this pack hiking, walking, biking, and it's been great for all activities.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and functional
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift and it's working out great. I have a similar one and got this as Christmas present for brother. Perfect for day trips and has even been used for overnight trips. Had to attach some gear to exterior, but worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: It has to be one of the best quality, and best designed pack I have ever ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pack for my wife, I have the same one in black. It has to be one of the best quality, and best designed pack I have ever owned (for this size) I will be a lifetime customer of Osprey as long as they keep this up.
customer_reviews.author: no1amigo

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this backpack on a few long hikes and it's been great. It holds everything I need (2L camelbak, 2 additional water bottles, snacks, sunscreen, etc), while keeping the load balanced. There's also a venting section on the back that helps keep my back cool. I would highly recommend this backpack for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Guy M. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: I used my pack to go to Alaska! I love it! Holds everything for traveling or for a day hike! I use it for work as well because I have to park a bit of a distance from my shop, I have a lot to carry, and my dog comes with me every day!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Bader

customer_reviews.title: Not great for petite people - rubs on neck
customer_reviews.text: I love the pack itself. Great size and pockets. I don’t like that the sides of the straps are so darn rough. They rub the sides of my neck and the back padding is very stiff and almost like cardboard on my back. I sent it back. I wanted to really like it though!
customer_reviews.author: Sueber

customer_reviews.title: After a month of daily use...
customer_reviews.text: The pack has held up well. Unlike some packs this one doesn't stain easily, which is good since mine is bright yellow. I haven't put it through the ringer, but it has held a fair amount of luggage and stood up to a light rain. I am completely satisfied with this pack.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Tankersley

customer_reviews.title: love this backpack
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for me. I've fit a 16" laptop, a Surface tablet, peripherals and power supplies in it simultaneously. Granted, that about used up all the space and was packed tightly, but use that for a gauge of whether or not it would work for you. Comfortable even fully loaded. If it broke today (which isn't likely, constructed well) I would buy another one immediately.
customer_reviews.author: cheeto12

customer_reviews.title: I really really love this backpack
customer_reviews.text: I really really love this backpack. I took it through a month-long fieldwork expedition in Tibet and it held up wonderfully. It's comfortable, durable, easy to clean, fits a lot. Other reviews have mentioned the fact that the side pockets don't hold larger water bottles like Nalgenes very well and that is true, but you can put water bottles in the big front pocket and other things in the sides. The color is nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

product_meta.title: Osprey Daylite Plus Daypack
product_meta.description: The Daylite Series started out with humble beginnings, a simple accessory to attach to our larger packs. However, its lightweight, simplicity, durability, comfortable carry and price has proven to be wildly popular, and today their popularity is undeniable. While the Daylite and Daylite Plus continue to serve well as add-on packs for traveling and more, they shine on their own with incredible versatility and are now available in an even more robust color palette than before. Waist: Adjustable 1.5 inches webbing hipbelt. No matter where you go, the Daylite series is backed by Osprey's All Mighty Guarantee.
feature_bullets: Large panel loading main compartment provides accessibility to inside contents
Dual stretch mesh side pockets provide additional storage options
The multi-function interior sleeve can be used for either a hydration reservoir or tablet. Main material is 210D Nylon Double Diamond Ripstop
Front panel shove-it pocket is great for stashing a light rain shell and other smaller items
Mesh-covered die-cut foam back panel provides both comfort and ventilation.
Total volume : 20L - Attaches to a variety of compatible Osprey packs

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
